item.description:
So let's do it, spread the word, and remember to vote yourself ~ barbara g.

 

Connecticut's 2012 Primary Day

This may be your LAST CHANCE EVER to hold a sign for Dr. Ron Paul - let's overcome the apathy and media blackouts and take a stand for Liberty, Freedom, Peace and Prosperity.

What are you doing for Liberty on April 24th? Some of our meetup members will be working in an official capacity at their respective polling stations. Others will be taking the day off from work to represent Ron Paul at their busiest area polling place holding a sign.

Exit Polling Form here: http://www.healthfreedom2012.com/Health_Freedom_2012_Exit%20Poll.pdf

Another option is to grab a clipboard and do some exit polling. You will need to stay 75 feet back from the station (just as you would a sign, it's usually posted where the line is) and are not allowed to influence or dissuade people from voting - stay candidate neutral while exit polling. We're just looking to see which Republican candidate they supported. Those with the equipment and means may want to videotape the entrances to the station while exit polling for numbers corroboration, this is also allowed by CT law as long as the usual distance requirement is met.

 

- Polling Projects and Apps -

You can also use technology instead, such as the Street Team app for Android.

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.locai.streetteams

 

There's also the PollWatcher Android app & project, though I'm not sure if this will be up and running for CT.

http://www.revolutionpac.com/Exit-Polling/

 

For Apple users there's a $1.99 app for ipads and phones called Straw Poll:

http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/straw-poll/id507188842?mt=8

 

- Watch the vote in CT -

There's also the http://www.ctvoterscount.org/ coalition. These folks have been watching the count for every election in CT since 2007. The hand counted districts in CT are picked at random prior to the vote so it's impossible to know where people will be needed until right before the primary. I have signed up and been in contact with the project organizer who has told me people will be likely notified just a few days before April 24th. http://www.ctelectionaudit.org/signup-to-be-notified-for-future-observations/

 

If anyone knows of any other CT projects or exit polling applications please let us know an we'll update the list.
item.name: CT's Polling Day 2012
